author: TEDx Talks
description:
Are you burnt out from constantly striving for more? Executive coach Nina Blackshear flips the script with a counterintuitive idea: the path to a richer, more intentional life may lie not in adding more, but in saying “no” and eliminating what no longer serves you. With warmth and clarity, she reveals how thoughtful elimination can create space for true fulfillment. 

Nina Blackshear is an engaging speaker and executive coach who leverages her wide-ranging background to spark innovative thinking and cultivate growth-oriented mindsets. With warmth and directness, she empowers individuals and organizations to identify "What's Next," embrace change, and achieve authentic success through fresh perspectives. Nina's dynamic keynotes blend expertise, humor, and actionable insights to drive forward-thinking solutions and lasting transformation. 

This talk was given at a TEDx event using the TED conference format but independently organized by a local community. Learn more at https://www.ted.
title: How to say no to social plans—thoughtfully | Nina Blackshear | TEDxJeffersonU

author: TEDx Talks
description:
How plant-based pet nutrition, backed by science and empathy, can extend pet longevity, reduce environmental harm, and reshape the future of sustainable living.
 Building FURRMATE ?? | PETA-Certified Vegan Dog Food | Backed by Vets, Loved by Pets | On a Mission to Nourish Dogs & Nurture the Planet This talk was given at a TEDx event using the TED conference format but independently organized by a local community. Learn more at https://www.ted.com/tedx
title: Strategy Meets Compassion: Revolutionizing Pet Nutrition | Paras Jain | TEDxSt Xaviers HS

author: TEDx Talks
description: Shares valuable insights on behind-the-mic opportunities in the radio industry, highlighting lesser-known roles, real challenges, and the skills needed to succeed. Passion, preparation, and practical experience can help aspiring professionals confidently step into the dynamic world of radio. Saurabh Kanojia is a Producer & Radio Jockey at well-known radio Station. He has worked as a Radio Producer with Radio networks like 95 FM, Fever 104 FM and has also worked as a Morning and Night show Producer for some years. This talk was given at a TEDx event using the TED conference format but independently organized by a local community. Learn more at https://www.ted.com/tedx
title: Dreams Behind The Mic | Rj Saurabh Kanojia | TEDxSt Xaviers HS

description: The central idea of the talk was how to bridge generational gap and make a world where generations understand each other and work towards an excellent future. A high school student with strong interest in communication and public speaking. This talk was given at a TEDx event using the TED conference format but independently organized by a local community. Learn more at https://www.ted.com/tedx
title: The Generational Gap | Riddhika Gupta | TEDxSt Xaviers HS

description:
Karan Shukla’s journey of rising through the ashes of personal loss , brain stroke , dropping out and building the only audio patented brand of India.
 GEN'z Speaker Wala || India’s first audio patented brand ✌?Solving Problem faced by Million's of Music lovers | Building DECIWOOD : Where creativity meets sounds ! This talk was given at a TEDx event using the TED conference format but independently organized by a local community. Learn more at https://www.ted.com/tedx

author: TEDx Talks
description: Tue Minh's talk shares her “green corner” project, a space she created to grow plants and bring more nature into her everyday life. The project comes from her worries about pollution, climate change, and especially deforestation, which she sees as destroying the green spaces and wildlife she loves. Her main message is that even a tiny green corner can be a first step: when students plant trees, care for plants, and talk about environmental problems, they raise awareness and inspire others to protect the planet. Winner of the Oxford Speakers 2025 competition and a student from class 5Q4, Oxford International Curriculum, Doan Thi Diem Hanoi Primary School This talk was given at a TEDx event using the TED conference format but independently organized by a local community. Learn more at https://www.ted.com/tedx
title: The Green corner project | Tue Minh Nguyen | TEDxDoan Thi Diem Hanoi Primary School

author: TEDx Talks
description: A unique tool of conscious appreciation that rewires the mind, raises emotional frequency, shifts energy real-time, deepens presence & accelerates transformation. Life Coach for High Performers  |  Neuro-Energetic Transformation Coach  | NLP Coach  |  Expert in Subconscious Rewiring | Founder of Gateway of Healing. This talk was given at a TEDx event using the TED conference format but independently organized by a local community. Learn more at https://www.ted.com/tedx
title: Gratitude isn’t enough until you do it like this  | Dr. Chandni Tugnait | TEDxSt Xaviers HS

author: TEDx Talks
description:
從財經主播走向極地，舒夢蘭這十五年走遍世界現場，看見冰融、棲地消失、人類與動物的脆弱命運。鏡頭下的畫面讓她理解：我們既是破壞者，也是能扭轉故事的修復者。她從南極冰原、非洲草原到北極海洋帶來呼喚：當我們願意看見、願意關心，每個人、每一天都能為地球的未來做出改變。

"Former news anchor Meng-Lan Shu spent fifteen years documenting the world’s most fragile places—melting ice, vanishing habitats, and the intertwined lives of humans and wildlife. Her journey revealed a stark truth: we are both the cause of the damage and the ones capable of repair. From Antarctica to Africa to the Arctic, she brings a simple call: when we choose to see and to care, every person, every day, can help shape a better future for our planet.

—

舒夢蘭，主持人與《守護我們的星球》導演，製播生態節目多次榮獲金鐘獎。從主播台飛到叢林、荒漠與極地，遠征115個外景地、超過21.8萬公里路程，她以台灣視角拍出跨越南北極的生態電影，用細膩影像見證氣候變遷與物種瀕危。從發聲者轉為行動守護者，她相信每一個人，都能在此時此地採取小行動、創造環境改變。

Meng-Lan Shu, The host and the director of “Guardians of Our Planet”, with multiple Golden Bell Awards for her ecological programs. From news studios to jungles, deserts, and polar regions, she has traveled to 115 locations and over 218,000 kilometers, doc
title: 我們要留給下一代什麼樣的星球？What Kind of Planet Will We Leave Behind?｜舒夢蘭 | Meng-Lan Shu | TEDxTaipei

author: TEDx Talks
description:
為了不讓別人失望，我們常常累到忘記自己。周慕姿指出：內耗不是因為我們不夠好，而是因為「太努力滿足別人的期待」。她以心理師的專業與自身經歷，提出三個關鍵練習。當你願意站在自己這一邊，不再逃避、不再討好、不再自我否定，人生才會開始往自己想去的方向前進。

Many of us exhaust ourselves trying not to disappoint others. Mu-Tzu Chou argues that inner conflict doesn’t come from inadequacy—it comes from overextending ourselves to meet expectations. Drawing from clinical insights and her own turning points, she offers three essential practices. Life begins to change only when we choose to stand on our own side, speak up for our needs, and believe that our existence has value beyond performance.

—

周慕姿，諮商心理師、暢銷作家與Podcast《周慕姿放心說》主持人。近30歲時從媒體背景轉身投入心理諮商，以《情緒勒索》《關係黑洞》《過度努力》等多本暢銷作品，也開設《停止內耗》心理線上課程，揭開現代人關係的焦慮與黑暗面。從曾陷入完美焦慮、到學會「讓別人失望也沒關係」，她以真實經歷帶領人們理解：當你能誠實面對自己，才是內耗的終點。

Mu-Tzu Chou, a counseling psychologist, bestselling author, and host of the podcast “Let’s Talk with Mu-Tzu.” After transitioning from media to psychology in her late twenties, she has published influential works such as Emotional Blackmail, Relationship Black
title: 停止內耗，從相信自己開始 To End Inner Conflict, Start by Believing in Yourself｜周慕姿 | Mu-Tzu Chou | TEDxTaipei

author: TEDx Talks
description:
Online scams and frauds are getting smarter, faster, and harder to detect — but a new breakthrough in quantum technology might finally turn the tables. In this video, the speaker reveals the quantum trick that scammers fear the most: a powerful concept called Quantum Position Verification (QPV). This technique uses the laws of quantum physics to prove exactly the position or location of the server of the website, making it almost impossible for scammers to fake identities, locations, or access your accounts from across the world. Use of Quantum entanglement leads multi-node quantum networks, which can offer ultra-secure unhackable communication enabling quantum position verification.
In this talk, you’ll discover:

(i) How scammers operate and impersonate trusted sources

(ii) Why online scams are so hard to stop using classical technology

(iii) What Quantum Position Verification is — explained simply

(iv) What Quantum entanglement is and why it is ultra-secure

(v) How quantum netw
title: The Quantum Trick that Scammers Fear the Most | Prof. Bhaskar Kanseri | TEDxIITDelhi

author: TEDx Talks
description:
The talk highlights how climate change creates completely different realities for different people. For some, a heat wave means higher electricity bills. For others, it means dying on a construction site. Speaking from her experience witnessing climate disasters devastate her home state, Manipur, and communities across India, she shows how the poorest communities are paying the highest price for a crisis they didn't cause.
She asks: Is this fair? And more importantly, will we help fix it? 
This is a call to build systems that protect everyone equally, not just those who can afford it.

 S Bituila is a PhD researcher at IIT Delhi specializing in climate change mitigation and net-zero emissions in land-use systems. She integrates indigenous knowledge with modern science to design context-specific climate solutions for vulnerable communities. Beyond her technical expertise, she is deeply committed to democratizing climate science and amplifying the voices of marginalized communities with
title: Why climate justice is a responsibility, not charity | S Bituila | TEDxIITDelhi

author: TEDx Talks
description:
What if Aladdin’s lamp was never about magic, but about responsibility?
In this powerful TEDx talk, the speaker explores how today’s AI — our digital genie — mirrors human bias, reshapes truth, and consumes vast energy. He reveals a new path forward through his research on semiconductor-based photonic matrix processors — computing systems that use light instead of electricity to make AI faster, cleaner, and sustainable.
Blending ethics, innovation, and imagination, he reminds us that the real magic of AI isn’t in the lamp — but in the wisdom of the hand that holds it.

 Deepak Jain is an Associate Professor at the Optics & Photonics Center, Indian Institute of Technology Delhi. Previously, he served as a faculty member in the Electrical Engineering Department at IIT Bombay. Earlier, he was a University Research Fellow at the University of Sydney and a Hans Christian Ørsted–Marie Curie Fellow at the Technical University of Denmark. He earned his Ph.D. from the Optoelectronics Research
title: Beyond the Rub: The Responsibility of Holding the AI Lamp | Prof. Deepak Jain | TEDxIITDelhi

author: TEDx Talks
description:
India is home to millions of hectares of barren, climate-vulnerable land. Can we heal our land, our livelihoods and our biodiversity? In this talk, the speaker shares how India can restore 100 million hectares of degraded land by codifying and scaling landscape restoration practices, leveraging technologies like geospatial and soil science and unlocking capital to power local enterprises.

 He spearheads a large-scale urbanization policy research and prototyping support program focused on the country’s urban growth & sustainability. He has been a respected thinker-practitioner working on critical issues of urbanization, climate change, transportation, & environment across various countries for decades. Mr. Pai was part of the Institute's founding team when he joined WRI India in 2008.

He graduated from the University of Mumbai as a civil engineer & earned a Master's degree in Transport Planning from the University of California, Berkeley. His work is rooted in systems thinking to neg
title: India’s land restoration opportunity | Madhav Pai | TEDxIITDelhi

author: TEDx Talks
description: This talk unveils how one can unlock their potential by developing a growth-driven ‘Rich Mindset’ through embracing their strengths, building valuable skills, and mastering financial management to make money work for them. Anmol Bhatnagar is the Founder & CEO at Elite Academic & Inland Mart and also serves Clinicx of Rajdhani as its Chief Executive Officer - Devoted to the goal of Universal Literacy For India & Universal Healthcare Accessibility & Affordability, through both these enterprises respectively. This talk was given at a TEDx event using the TED conference format but independently organized by a local community. Learn more at https://www.ted.com/tedx
title: Beyond Money-The Rich Mindset that Creates Real Wealth | Anmol Bhatnagar | TEDxSt Xaviers HS

author: TEDx Talks
description:
Ryo shares his experiences of balancing competitive sports with academics, as well as the lessons and values he learnt. 

His talk encompasses the challenges he faced trying to balance the two and the important lessons he gained from this experience. 

Through his speech, Ryo hopes to leave everyone with a thought on how to approach life and the art of balancing its many aspects.  Ryo is currently a student at SJI International School, Singapore. He has a background in competitive sport, specifically Tennis. This talk was given at a TEDx event using the TED conference format but independently organized by a local community. Learn more at https://www.ted.com/tedx
title: Striking the Middle Ground: A Story of Challenge, Balance, and Growth | Ryo Lim | TEDxSJII Youth

author: TEDx Talks
description: 私たちは「ごみ」という存在を、単に不要なものとして蔑視していないだろうか？「ごみ」と向き合うことは、実は自分自身の価値観や社会のありようを問い直すことにつながる。 総合地球環境学研究所教授。京都大学在学中の1999年に「京大ゴミ部」を立ち上げて以来、一貫して「ごみ」を研究テーマとしてきた。恩師との出会いを機に「ごみ」研究の道へ進み、45年以上続く家庭ごみ調査などを通して、「ごみ」から社会の変化や人々の暮らしを読み解いている。本トークでは、登壇者が「ごみ」に宛てた手紙という形で、26年間の活動で得た気づきを語る。単なる削減運動ではなく、「ごみ」の視点に立つことで見えてくる社会の課題や、弱者の立場に寄り添うことの大切さを伝え、私たち一人ひとりの行動変容を促す。 This talk was given at a TEDx event using the TED conference format but independently organized by a local community. Learn more at https://www.ted.com/tedx
title: 拝啓「ごみ」様 | Misuzu Asari | TEDxKyotoUniversity

author: TEDx Talks
description:
最も大切なはずの家族にイライラしてしまうのはなぜか？
家族という"身内"をあえて“他者”と見るという逆説的な視点から、家族関係を問い直す。 「哲学による社会貢献の新たな可能性」を信じ、元禅僧としての経験も活かしつつ、多くの人に哲学がおもしろくて身近になるよう「哲学コミュニケーター」を名乗り、哲学ワークショップなどの様々な活動を行っている。
哲学を知識人のものから「みんなのもの」へと解放することが夢。 This talk was given at a TEDx event using the TED conference format but independently organized by a local community. Learn more at https://www.ted.com/tedx
title: 家族にイライラするのはなぜ？ー家族関係を哲学するー | Yasushi Osumi | TEDxKyotoUniversity

author: TEDx Talks
description:
「畫畫能當飯吃嗎？」這是許多藝術創作者常面臨的質疑（不論是來自自我或是周圍的人）。馬渝婷，一位年輕的似顏繪街頭藝人，用她的行動打破了這個社會的框架。

從高中成績不上不下的迷惘，到休學徒步環島；從被親戚看衰，到以獨創的「自由付費」模式在台灣、甚至遠赴西雅圖、墨爾本街頭作畫。馬渝婷打破了「設計的包容性」的侷限，讓所有人皆能享受馬渝婷的設計，將一個更具包容性、可取用性的設計予以實踐。

在這場充滿活力的演講中，她分享了如何在街頭遇見生命的百態：從癌症病患最後的畫像，到墨爾本街頭的哲學教授。她證明了當你勇敢跨出舒適圈，任何的專長不僅能養活自己，更能連結人心。

“Can art put food on the table?” It’s a question many creators face—whether from their own doubts or from the people around them. Joyce Ma, a young street portrait artist, challenges that framework through her actions.  

From feeling lost as an average high school student to taking a leave of absence from school and walking around Taiwan on foot; from being doubted by relatives to sketching on the streets in Taiwan—and even traveling to Seattle and Melbourne—with her unique pay-what-you-want model, she turns art into something more inclusive and accessible.  

In this energetic talk, she shares the many faces of life she’s encountered on the streets—from drawing a cancer patient’s final portrait to meeting a
title: 突破框架：街頭畫筆下的自由與包容 | 馬 渝婷 Joyce Ma | TEDxTunghai U

author: TEDx Talks
description:
In this TEDx talk, Siddharth Sagar talks about his journey of recovering from mental health issues, “How he found spirituality to recover from mental health”. In his school days, he found himself more inclined to acting and mimicry and got exposed to the acting industry. Mimicking the personalities in front of personalities themselves. Light Camera Action, it was fascinating but had bad effect on his mental health. He talks about his existence, and at young age, he found himself into addiction and diagnosed with several mental health issues.

His recovery emerged not through lifelong medication, but through spirituality, inner awareness, and reclaiming his authentic self. He now advocates extensively for addiction awareness, a crisis recognized globally by WHO. His message is simple yet powerful: the real pursuit is not external success, but discovering the answer to the question, “Who am I?”
With silence, spirituality, and the question that finally shook him awake: Who am I beyond my
title: Spirituality: The key to Mental Health and Addiction | Siddharth Sagar | TEDxIIMT University

author: TEDx Talks
description: Khanh An's talk is an emotional story about growing up in a family where her dad has to work far away, and how distance doesn’t stop them from loving each other. She shares the sadness of missing her father in everyday moments, but also describes the creative ways her family stays close, like regular video call, and planned activities when he comes home. The main message is that even when families are apart, effort, communication, and small rituals can keep their connection strong. Runner-up of the Oxford Speakers 2025 competition and a student from class 5Q3, Oxford International Curriculum, Doan Thi Diem Hanoi Primary School This talk was given at a TEDx event using the TED conference format but independently organized by a local community. Learn more at https://www.ted.com/tedx
title: Seeds of togetherness | Khanh An Do Hoang | TEDxDoan Thi Diem Hanoi Primary School

author: TEDx Talks
description: Artist Tuan Cry shares his passion for Vietnamese folk music has guided his life and career. He tells the story of falling in love with "Quan Họ", choosing this traditional path despite many challenges, and continuing because he truly believes in the cultural value and emotional power of this music. The main message is that when a person dares to believe in their passion and stays committed, that belief can turn difficulties into motivation and create art that inspires others. Tuấn Cry, whose real name is Nguyễn Sỹ Tuấn, was born 1992, in Bắc Ninh, Vietnam. Coming from a family with a rich artistic tradition, including a mother and sister who are "quan họ" folk singers, he initially gained fame as an internet phenomenon with humorous parody music and catchy covers. Starting his professional music career around 2017-2019, Tuấn Cry evolved from making parody videos to becoming a serious artist blending rap, hip-hop, and traditional Vietnamese folk elements with playful, witty lyrics. He
title: Hãy tin rằng mình có thể | Sy Tuan Nguyen | TEDxDoan Thi Diem Hanoi Primary School

author: TEDx Talks
description:
在社會對立加劇的年代，王增勇選擇用「說故事」打開對話的可能。他以自身的生命歷程，示範脆弱中的溫柔力量，並開設〈同志生命美學〉課堂，創造一個安全的空間，讓學生用故事靠近自己與他人。從基督徒同志、跨性別學生，到身心疾病者與照顧者，他看見每一段故事都能召喚另一段故事，改變一個人生。

In a time of deep social division, Frank TY Wang turns to storytelling as a way to reopen dialogue. Through his own life journey, he shows how vulnerability can create connection, and through his course “Aesthetics of LGBTQ+ Lives,” he builds a space where students explore themselves and others through personal stories. From queer Christians to transgender youth, from people with mental health struggles to caregivers, he has witnessed how one honest story can call forth another—and quietly change a life.

—

王增勇，國立政治大學社工研究所教授。作為政治圈首位公開出櫃的同志政務官，關注原住民長照、家庭照顧者、同志權益…等議題。他不僅是研究者、更是行動者，開設《同志生命美學》課程，用自身故事創造影響力漣漪，透過「聽與說故事」，帶領人們撕下弱勢標籤，讓「對話」成為開展生命的新空間。

Frank TY Wang, a professor at the Graduate Institute of Social Work at National Chengchi University and the first openly gay political appointee in Taiwan’s political sphere. His work spans Indigenous long-t
title: 一堂「改變一生」的生命故事課 A Life-Changing Storytelling Class｜王增勇 | Frank TY Wang | TEDxTaipei

author: TEDx Talks
description: Laylah is a solo acoustic act delivering heartfelt performances, taking audiences on an emotional journey through authentic and meaningful story telling with enriching melodies. At the age of 9, Laylah Baines developed a love for music while attending piano lessons alongside her two older brothers. Several years later, she gravitated to learning guitar and singing, drawing inspiration from the likes of Kasey Chambers, Dolly Parton and John Williamson. She has performed on stages at various festivals and events and opened for Sara Storer and 2025 Australian Idol Runner-up Iilysh Retallick. Laylah writes and composes instrumental and lyrical works, reflecting on her own personal experiences and the world around her. This talk was given at a TEDx event using the TED conference format but independently organized by a local community. Learn more at https://www.ted.com/tedx
title: Stories in song  | Laylah Baines | TEDxAlbury

author: TEDx Talks
description:
We acknowledge the Wiradjuri people as the traditional custodians of the land in which we live and work and we pay our respects to Elders past, present, and future for they hold the memories, culture, tradition, and hopes of Aboriginal and Torres Strait Islander people that contribute to our community.

Dyu yindyamali Wiradjuri mayiny. Wiradjuri bala walumaldhaanygalang ngurambang-gu. Ngurambang-ga ngiyanhi murunwigi yindyamali-yanhi mudyigaanggalam-bu balumbambal-bu. Nganhaguliyalaa wirimbili giilanggalam-bu winhangangidyal-bu Wiradjuri-giyalang-bu ngurambangguwal-giyalang-bu. Darren Wighton is a Wiradjuri man from Condobolin in Central NSW, and has resided in Albury for more than 25 years. He is a skilled artist, cultural performer,  and community leader who has worked in education, community orgs and pastoral care and now working for local land services. Darren has a passion for his language and culture and designs cultural programs to cater for schools, community groups and indivi
title: TEDxAlbury - Welcome to Country | Darren Wighton | TEDxAlbury

author: TEDx Talks
description:
In this talk the speaker explores why financial risk communication must become a regulatory mandate. In this insightful TEDx talk, the speaker also discusses how structured and transparent risk messaging can safeguard investors, build lasting trust, and strengthen financial markets. Discover behavioural design strategies that make risk communication clear and effective for all market participants.

 Debashish's current research areas include cryptocurrency user adoption, B2B marketing, and digital trust architectures. His work advances understanding of user acceptance and regulatory adaptation in decentralized systems. An engineer by training, he has pursued advanced studies in psychology, economics, business, and technology law, enriching his interdisciplinary perspective.
A serial entrepreneur, Debashish has founded ventures integrating technology and behavioral insight to address digital-era challenges. His current startup, Cerify—incubated at IIT Delhi’s FITT—develops AI and block
title: Building a Case for Mandatory Risk Communications | Debashish Sakunia | TEDxIITDelhi

author: TEDx Talks
description: Le Nguyen's talk shares how her family slowly changed their daily habits to live in a greener, more eco-friendly way, starting with simple actions like saying no to plastic bags and other single-use plastics. She explains the environmental problems caused by everyday plastic waste, then shows how small choices at home—reusable bags, bottles, and containers—help reduce trash and protect the planet. The main message is that any family can start with small, practical steps and together make a real difference for the environment. Third Prize winner of the Oxford Speakers 2025 competition and a student from class 5Q3, Oxford International Curriculum, Doan Thi Diem Hanoi Primary School. This talk was given at a TEDx event using the TED conference format but independently organized by a local community. Learn more at https://www.ted.com/tedx
title: How my family started living greener | Le Nguyen Doan | TEDxDoan Thi Diem Hanoi Primary School

author: TEDx Talks
description: Huyen An's talk shares the idea that big environmental change always begins with one person deciding to do something different in their daily life. She shows how simple choices—like saying no to single-use plastics, carrying a reusable bottle, and picking up litter—can inspire friends, families, and communities to follow. The main message is that no one is “too small” to help save the planet; when one person starts, their small actions can spread and create a powerful, positive impact on the environment. Third Prize winner of the Oxford Speakers 2025 competition and a student from class 5Q4, Oxford International Curriculum, Doan Thi Diem Hanoi Primary School. This talk was given at a TEDx event using the TED conference format but independently organized by a local community. Learn more at https://www.ted.com/tedx
title: Positive change starts with one person | Huyen An Cao | TEDxDoan Thi Diem Hanoi Primary School

author: TEDx Talks
description: Chau Anh's talk shows that kids are not “too small” to change the world, especially when it comes to protecting the planet. The speaker shares simple actions children can take—using less plastic, picking up trash in their communities, and sorting waste correctly—and explains how these habits can also inspire adults to recycle better and live more sustainably. The main message is that when kids speak up, act together, and teach others, their small daily choices can add up to big environmental change. Third Prize winner of the Oxford Speakers 2025 competition and a student from class 5Q4, Oxford International Curriculum, Doan Thi Diem Hanoi Primary School. This talk was given at a TEDx event using the TED conference format but independently organized by a local community. Learn more at https://www.ted.com/tedx
title: How kids can change the world | Chau Anh Pham | TEDxDoan Thi Diem Hanoi Primary School

author: TEDx Talks
description: Ngoc Han's talk explains that words have the power to “make or break” people, because what we say can strongly influence how others feel, think, and see themselves. She shows that positive words like encouragement, support, and praise can lift someone up, while negative words such as insults or harsh criticism can deeply hurt and stay in a person’s mind for a long time. The main message is a simple reminder: choose your words carefully, because even small comments can create big impacts in someone’s life. Runner-up of the Oxford Speakers 2025 competition and a student from class 5Q4, Oxford International Curriculum, Doan Thi Diem Hanoi Primary School This talk was given at a TEDx event using the TED conference format but independently organized by a local community. Learn more at https://www.ted.com/tedx
title: The Power of Words  | Ngoc Han Dao | TEDxDoan Thi Diem Hanoi Primary School

author: TEDx Talks
description: The speaker, at 76 years old, shared inspiring insights on embracing aging with vitality. She emphasized the importance of physical fitness, mental resilience, and a positive mindset in maintaining strength and energy at any age. Through her own journey, she demonstrated that age is not a barrier to achieving wellness, pursuing passions, and leading an active, fulfilling life. Dr. Preeti Singh, Professor with over five decades in academia, has taught at Jesus and Mary College (University of Delhi) and as Head of PG Department of International Business at JIMS Kalkaji. She was Managing Editor of Journal 8M and has worked in corporate and entrepreneurial roles, including owning a fashion boutique. Widely published with award-winning research, she has authored books such as Investment Management, Portfolio Management, and Fundamentals of Financial Management. She has presented papers and delivered lectures in Sweden, Germany, USA, Canada, and Thailand, and conducted FDPs and MDPs. Curren
title: Longevity, Aging & Ageless Strength | Dr. Preeti Singh | TEDxJIMS Kalkaji Women

author: TEDx Talks
description: Davis wants to provide audiences with valuable tools to improve community support systems and challenge misconceptions about victims of sexual violence that have become heirlooms.  Jonathan Davis is a senior philosophy major at Colby College from Vermont. With a special interest in law, he works as a peer educator in Colby's sexual violence prevention classes and spend last summer working with the Executive Office of Public Safety and Security on their Sex Offender Registry Board. This talk was given at a TEDx event using the TED conference format but independently organized by a local community. Learn more at https://www.ted.com/tedx
title: Recantation as an heirloom | Jonathan Davis | TEDxColby College

author: TEDx Talks
description: Mark reflects on the role of language in identity and personal growth. Through stories of regret and rediscovery, he shows how learning languages fosters empathy, builds relationships, and helps us redefine who we are. Mark Shaw is a project manager, a U.S. Army veteran, and a proud EAB alumnus. His global journey has taken him from a diplomatic childhood to military deployments and to global trade shows. This talk was given at a TEDx event using the TED conference format but independently organized by a local community. Learn more at https://www.ted.com/tedx
title: Inspiring Change through Language Learning | Mark Shaw | TEDxEAB Youth

author: TEDx Talks
description:
With raw honesty and lyrical grace, Clara Lösel shares poems rooted in personal experience – giving voice to stories of vulnerability, resilience, and self-discovery. Her performance blends spoken word and presence, creating space for reflection and connection. With a reach of over 20 million people each month, Clara Lösel - poetry artist, SPIEGEL bestselling author and live performer - has become one of the most influential voices of her generation.
Combining poetic language with social thought leadership, Clara's performances are invitations to pause, reflect, and connect - across generations and perspectives. This talk was given at a TEDx event using the TED conference format but independently organized by a local community. Learn more at https://www.ted.com/tedx
title: Poetry with Purpose | Clara Lösel | TEDxMitte

author: TEDx Talks
description: Fayola draws parallels between Earth science and personal growth, reflecting on how natural processes can teach us about change. Her talk invites us to look deeper at the forces that shape our transformation. Fayola Garner is a passionate science educator, EAB alumna, and lifelong learner whose curiosity about how the world works has shaped both her teaching and her journey. This talk was given at a TEDx event using the TED conference format but independently organized by a local community. Learn more at https://www.ted.com/tedx
title: Weathering Change | Fayola Garner | TEDxEAB Youth

author: TEDx Talks
description: Roberto explores how true inspiration doesn’t always come from a spark; it’s built through accountability, care, and quiet leadership. His talk invites us to recognize the power of steady, responsible action in driving meaningful change. Roberto Miyamoto is an educator, environmental advocate, and lifelong learner whose curiosity about how systems work — from ecosystems to classrooms — has shaped his approach to teaching and leadership. This talk was given at a TEDx event using the TED conference format but independently organized by a local community. Learn more at https://www.ted.com/tedx
title: Maybe You Don’t Need to Be Inspired to Inspire | Roberto Miyamoto | TEDxEAB Youth

author: TEDx Talks
description:
In this heartfelt talk, Pascal Keller shares insights from speaking with over 20,000 young people across Germany, revealing a striking truth: despite vastly different backgrounds, almost every young person struggles with the same question—Am I good enough?

From teens scrolling through social media to children fleeing war, the pressures of modern life amplify self-doubt, anxiety, and fear of the future. Drawing on a personal story of mentorship and encouragement while teaching in Mexico, Pascal illustrates the transformative power of one believer: a person who sees, supports, and believes in a young person’s potential.

Through seminars in schools, he empowers students to discover their strengths, build confidence, and recognize their worth. Pascal’s talk is a call to action: every child needs at least one believer, and that one person can change everything. Pascal Keller is the founder of MEIN MUTIGER WEG, a startup that empowers young people to discover and pursue their own unique c
title: One Believer Can Change a Life | Pascal Keller | TEDxMitte

author: TEDx Talks
description:
In this inspiring talk, economist and advocate Aysel reveals how neurodiversity—the natural variation in how our brains work—holds the key to unlocking untapped creativity, talent, and innovation in our workplaces, schools, and communities.

Through her own journey of discovery, Aysel shows how traits often labeled as “challenges”—like ADHD, autism, or dyslexia—are actually superpowers when recognized and supported. From overlooked candidates in hiring processes to rigid school systems, she highlights how society routinely misses opportunities to harness unique perspectives.

Aysel challenges us to rethink inclusion: to create spaces that celebrate difference, embrace diverse thinking, and empower every individual to contribute fully. By seeing neurodiverse people not as exceptions but as essential to progress, she paints a vision of a world where collaboration multiplies our collective strength—and where everyone’s superpowers can shine. Prof. Dr. Aysel Yollu-Tok is an economist and
title: Unlocking the Power of Neurodiversity | Prof. Dr. Aysel Yollu-Tok | TEDxMitte

author: TEDx Talks
description: Thomas Diekamp, Climate Protection Officer at AWO Bundesverband e.V. shares a personal story about aging, transformation, and adaptability in a rapidly changing world. Thomas Diekamp is a sustainability expert supporting organizations in the field of social work on their path to climate neutrality. His work connects environmental responsibility with social impact, helping institutions become role models for a just and sustainable future. Through practical action and collaboration, he drives systemic change from within communities. This talk was given at a TEDx event using the TED conference format but independently organized by a local community. Learn more at https://www.ted.com/tedx
title: The Surprising Power of Adaptability | Thomas Diekamp | TEDxMitte

author: TEDx Talks
description: This talk explores how learning multiple languages is more than an academic skill; it’s a transformative journey that reshapes the way we think, connect, and engage with the world. Rafael shares how language can deepen empathy, broaden perspectives, and serve as a powerful bridge across cultures. Rafael Dias is a passionate linguist and educator at EAB, whose path to becoming a polyglot has been shaped by curiosity, challenges, and a deep appreciation for languages. This talk was given at a TEDx event using the TED conference format but independently organized by a local community. Learn more at https://www.ted.com/tedx
title: Unlocking the World Through the Power of Language | Rafael Dias | TEDxEAB Youth

author: TEDx Talks
description:
In this talk, Alexander Leutner explores how 3D-bioprinting could transform medicine by enabling the creation of human tissues and organs—and how generosity, science, and technology can redefine what it means to give life.

He highlights the limits of current medicine through his personal story of donating a kidney to his brother, underscoring the urgent need for new solutions as thousands die each year waiting for transplants.

At Cellbricks in Berlin, Alexander’s team is building a light-based biofabrication platform that rapidly prints complex human tissues with surgical precision, including vasculature and multiple cell types. From wound healing and reconstruction to liver patches and, one day, full organ replacements, this technology points to a future where access to life-saving organs is no longer left to chance.

Alexander invites us to imagine a world where organ scarcity is eliminated—and giving life becomes possible on demand through scientific innovation. Alexander Leutner
title: Biofabricating the future of organs | Alexander Leutner | TEDxMitte

author: TEDx Talks
description:
What if the mental health crisis among young people could be solved by meeting them where they truly are? In this powerful talk, Melanie Eckert, founder of krisenchat, shares the story of Marie—a 12-year-old struggling with anxiety, depression, and loneliness—and reveals the invisible battles millions of young people face every day.

Through her work building a digital, peer-informed crisis chat, Melanie demonstrates how support can be immediate, anonymous, and accessible in the spaces where young people actually spend their time. Drawing from real stories, personal experience, and the lessons learned from thousands of conversations, she challenges us to rethink youth mental health—not as a distant system problem, but as a collective responsibility.

This talk is a call to action: to listen to young voices, empower them with tools and communities, and transform the way society responds to their struggles—because the future depends on the care we provide today. Melanie Eckert is a psyc
title: The Urgency of Youth Mental Health | Melanie Eckert | TEDxMitte

author: TEDx Talks
description:
In this thought-provoking talk, digital futurist Max Penk explores a startling reality: in 2025, non-human agents online outnumber humans. From AI bots that convincingly debate on Reddit to algorithmic systems shaping what we see, like, and even believe, Max reveals how the digital world is no longer just a reflection of us—it’s reshaping who we are.

Through vivid examples, he shows how bots influence language, manipulate engagement, and even affect democracy, challenging us to rethink authenticity, trust, and identity in the age of intelligent machines. Max argues that the next frontier isn’t teaching machines to be human—it’s proving that we, humans, can still act in ways machines cannot.

This talk is a call to awareness and action: understand the invisible systems shaping your digital life, protect authenticity, and reclaim the human presence in a world increasingly shared with bots. Max Penk is a creative technologist passionate about using innovation and storytelling to inspire
title: Proving Identity in The Digital World | Max Penk | TEDxMitte

author: TEDx Talks
description:
In this eye-opening talk, media entrepreneur Max explores how truth and trust in journalism have been upended by technology – and how AI might help us reclaim a shared reality.

From the printing press to the rise of the internet, Max traces the evolution of information, showing how the democratization of content disrupted journalism’s economic foundation and fractured our common understanding of truth. Social media and the creator economy amplified noise, leaving democracy vulnerable to misinformation.

Now, AI offers a new opportunity: to curate knowledge, prioritize trustworthy sources, and act as a modern gatekeeper for truth. Max envisions a “democratic media by design,” where technology helps protect factual integrity while empowering citizens, ensuring that our societies can continue to function on a foundation of shared understanding. Maximilian Ziche is the founder and CEO of getpress, one of Europe’s leading PR agencies. Originally trained as a journalist, he combines storyt
title: Shared truth in the age of algorithms  | Maximilian Ziche | TEDxMitte

author: TEDx Talks
description: In 1945, Germany was rubble; by 1960, it was an economic leader. The essential variable wasn’t luck, it was speed. This talk argues that velocity is a moral and practical lever for progress, yet the most undervalued variable in progress. The talk diagnoses medicine’s bradycardia: layers of well-meant bureaucracy that turn years into funerals, and introduces a practical “digital pacemaker” to compress discovery-to-delivery from 12 years to 5. Anchored in a simple creative rhythm: Try. Learn. Build. The talk shows how faster iteration saves lives, lowers cost, and multiplies possibility. This is a manifesto for urgency. Zina Sarif is a scientist and entrepreneur, founder and CEO of Yendou, a platform that helps speed up how new medicines move from idea to patient. As former cancer researcher, she turned her lab experience into a mission: to make clinical trials faster, smarter, and more human, so progress in medicine keeps pace with discovery. This talk was given at a TEDx event using t
title: The Pulse of Progress | Zina Sarif | TEDxMitte

author: TEDx Talks
description:
In this captivating talk, ecologist and pollination researcher Alexandra-Maria Klein takes us on a journey from her childhood on a diverse small-scale farm to groundbreaking research on wild bees and pollinators around the world.

By showing how seedless fruits, monocultures, and declining habitats impact our food quality, Alexandra-Maria reveals why healthy ecosystems—and the insects within them—are essential for the fruits, vegetables, coffee, and even chocolate we rely on. From wild bees that fly in bad weather to bats that pollinate agave for tequila, she highlights the intricate networks that sustain our diets and our planet.

More than science, this talk is a call to action: plant bell flowers, grow your own food, create habitats for pollinators, and understand the hidden connections between biodiversity, nutrition, and justice. Alexandra-Maria Klein inspires us to protect and celebrate the tiny heroes keeping our world alive and delicious. Prof. Dr. Alexandra-Maria Klein is an
title: Why the future needs bees, not bots  | Prof. Dr. Alexandra-Maria Klein | TEDxMitte
